In the closed-half-affine finrank-one case, every point lies in the mixed convex hull.

Base case: one-dimensional closed convex sets without lines are generated by extreme points and directions.

In dimension > 1, a closed convex set with no lines is neither affine nor a closed half of an affine set.

lemma not_affine_or_closedHalf_of_noLines_finrank_gt_one {n : } {C : Set (Fin n )} (hNoLines : y : Fin n , y 0 y (-Set.recessionCone C) Set.recessionCone C) (hfin : 1 < Module.finrank (affineSpan C).direction) : ( A : AffineSubspace (EuclideanSpace (Fin n)), (A : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) = (euclideanEquiv n).symm '' C) ( (A : AffineSubspace (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) (f : (EuclideanSpace (Fin n)) [] ) (a : ), f 0 (euclideanEquiv n).symm '' C = (A : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) {x | f x a}) := by classical let e := euclideanEquiv n have hNoLinesE : y : EuclideanSpace (Fin n), y 0 y (-Set.recessionCone (e.symm '' C)) Set.recessionCone (e.symm '' C) := noLines_equiv_fin (n := n) (C := C) hNoLines have hfinE : 1 < Module.finrank (affineSpan (e.symm '' C)).direction := by rw [finrank_direction_affineSpan_equiv (n := n) (C := C)] exact hfin constructor intro hAff rcases hAff with A, hAeq have hAeq' : (A : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) = e.symm '' C := by simpa using hAeq have hspan : affineSpan (e.symm '' C) = A := by simpa [hAeq'] using (AffineSubspace.affineSpan_coe (s := A) (k := )) have hfinA : 1 < Module.finrank A.direction := by rw [ hspan] exact hfinE have hpos : 0 < Module.finrank A.direction := by exact lt_trans (Nat.succ_pos 0) hfinA obtain v, hvne := (Module.finrank_pos_iff_exists_ne_zero (R := ) (M := A.direction)).1 hpos let v' : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) := v have hvdir : v' A.direction := v.property have hvne' : v' 0 := by intro hv0 apply hvne apply Subtype.ext simpa [v'] using hv0 have hvrec : v' Set.recessionCone (e.symm '' C) := by intro x hx t ht := A) hvdir' hxA have hxA'' : x + t v' (A : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) := by simpa [vadd_eq_add, add_comm, add_left_comm, add_assoc] using hxA' simpa [hAeq'] using hxA'' have hvrec_neg : (-v') Set.recessionCone (e.symm '' C) := by intro x hx t ht have hxA : x A := by simpa [hAeq'.symm] using hx have hvdir' : t (-v') A.direction := by simpa using (A.direction.smul_mem t (A.direction.neg_mem hvdir)) have hxA' : (t (-v')) + x A := AffineSubspace.vadd_mem_of_mem_direction (s := A) hvdir' hxA have hxA'' : x + t (-v') (A : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) := by simpa [vadd_eq_add, add_comm, Extreme points of a mixed convex hull lie in the point-generators.

Suppose Unknown identifier `S'`S' is another set of point-elements and direction-elements such that:

(1) Unknown identifier `C`C is fully generated by Unknown identifier `S'`S', i.e. (here formalized as a mixed convex hull mixedConvexHull sorry sorry : Set (Fin ?m.1 )mixedConvexHull Unknown identifier `S`S Unknown identifier `S`S).

(2) (Regularity condition) No half-line in contains an unbounded subset of the point-elements of Unknown identifier `S'`S' (here: the intersection of Unknown identifier `S`S with any ray is bounded).

Then Unknown identifier `S`sorry sorry : PropS Unknown identifier `S'`S' (here: every extreme point belongs to Unknown identifier `S`S, and every extreme direction belongs to Unknown identifier `S`S).

lemma recessionCone_eq_singleton_zero_of_closed_bounded_convex_fin {n : } {C : Set (Fin n )} (hCne : C.Nonempty) (hCclosed : IsClosed C) (hCconv : Convex C) (hCbdd : Bornology.IsBounded C) : Set.recessionCone C = ({0} : Set (Fin n )) := by classical let e := euclideanEquiv n let C' : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n)) := e.symm '' C have hC'ne : C'.Nonempty := by rcases hCne with x, hx exact e.symm x, x, hx, rfl have hC'closed : IsClosed C' := by exact (e.symm.toHomeomorph.isClosed_image).2 hCclosed have hC'conv : Convex C' := by simpa [C'] using hCconv.linear_image (e.symm.toLinearMap) have hC'bounded : Bornology.IsBounded C' := by simpa [C'] using (e.symm.lipschitz.isBounded_image hCbdd) have hrecC' : Set.recessionCone C' = ({0} : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) := by exact (bounded_iff_recessionCone_eq_singleton_zero (C := C') hC'ne hC'closed hC'conv).1 hC'bounded have hEq : Set.recessionCone C = e '' Set.recessionCone C' := by have hEq' := recessionCone_image_linearEquiv (e := e.toLinearEquiv) (C := C') have himage : e '' C' = C := by ext x constructor rintro y, z, hz, rfl, rfl simpa using hz intro hx exact e.symm x, x, hx, rfl, by simp simpa [himage, C'] using hEq' have hzero : e '' ({0} : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) = ({0} : Set (Fin n )) := by ext y constructor rintro x, hx, rfl have hx0 : x = 0 := by simpa [Set.mem_singleton_iff] using hx simp [hx0] intro hy have hy0 : y = 0 := by simpa [Set.mem_singleton_iff] using hy subst hy0 exact 0, by simp, by simp calc Set.recessionCone C = e '' Set.recessionCone C' := hEq _ = e '' ({0} : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) := by simp [hrecC'] _ = ({0} : Set (Fin n )) := hzero

Mixed convex hull with empty directions reduces to the usual convex hull.

lemma mixedConvexHull_empty_directions_eq_convexHull {n : } (S : Set (Fin n )) : mixedConvexHull (n := n) S ( : Set (Fin n )) = convexHull S := by classical have hrepr := mixedConvexHull_eq_conv_add_ray_eq_conv_add_cone (n := n) S ( : Set (Fin n )) have hray : ray n ( : Set (Fin n )) = ({0} : Set (Fin n )) := by ext x constructor intro hx have hx' : x = 0 x rayNonneg n ( : Set (Fin n )) := by simpa [ray, Set.mem_insert_iff] using hx cases hx' with | inl hx0 => simp [hx0] | inr hxray => rcases hxray with d, hd, t, ht, rfl exact hd.elim intro hx have hx0 : x = 0 := by simpa [Set.mem_singleton_iff] using hx subst hx0 exact (Set.mem_insert_iff).2 (Or.inl rfl) have hadd : S + ({0} : Set (Fin n )) = S := by ext x constructor intro hx rcases (Set.mem_add.mp hx) with a, ha, b, hb, rfl have hb0 : b = 0 := by simpa [Set.mem_singleton_iff] using hb simpa [hb0] using ha intro hx exact Set.mem_add.mpr x, hx, 0, by simp, by simp calc mixedConvexHull (n := n) S ( : Set (Fin n )) = conv (S + ray n ( : Set (Fin n ))) := hrepr.1 _ = conv (S + ({0} : Set (Fin n ))) := by simp [hray] _ = conv S := by simp [hadd] _ = convexHull S := by simp [conv]
